text:
Hi,

I'm actually using the PVCS task in ANT 1.5.1
Everything is fine with it, ant it works well with Windows 2000 and PVCS v6.8 
(for the knowlegde).

But, in my opinion, a little something is missing in it, and I would like to 
know your opinion about it.
In fact, when you get your archives, the task doesn't "get" it if the 
destination directory doesn't exists... I actually use the task to build 
packages from scratch, and I must create all of them (the destination 
directories) in a previous task.
My project is big enough so that it is very tiring to do it, and if someone 
adds a directory in the PVCS project, I must add it (them!) in my specific 
task, with the risk to have an incomplete package if I forget it.

In PVCS, the get command creates the destination directories if they are not.
Is it possible to have an option in the task to do the same thing or not?

Thanks a lot guys...
creator: stephane.bocquet@delta-diffusion.fr
snewton@io.com
text:
Can the submitter please attach a copy of the target where you call the PVCS
task?  There code to automatically create the directories is there, in the
createFolders() method, so perhaps there is some other issue with either PVCS or
the configuration. I've been using it for quite some time now and have never had
to manually create the directories if I've specified the correct values for pvcs
task. Typically this means setting the filenameFormat and lineStart correctly.

Hi,

Ok, I've set the correct values for PVCS task (lineStart). That wasn't easy and 
very clear for me to understand in the Javadoc.

So, for the info:
If you are on a Windows Platform and accessing the repository of PVCS by a 
connected drive, you must set the value of the lineStart option to the drive 
letter of your connected drive.

e.g. : My repository is :
<property name="pvcs.repository" value="${pvcs.home}/DEVT/WATOO"/>
and my lineStart option is :
<property name="pvcs.linestart" value=""J:"/>

Perhaps we could improve all this. I don't know how, but there is surrely a to 
do that.

Hope this could help someone...
creator: stephane.bocquet@delta-diffusion.fr
snewton@io.com
text:
Agree the lineStart property hasn't worked out too well. There's a proposal in
bug 3219 with some source code that changes the behavior to accept paths with
any alpha followed by a colon, in addition to / or \\, and this seems a better
solution.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 3219 ***
